description: System-generated unique identifier for this purchase-order line record.
Parent PO identifier to which this line belongs.
Indicator that the line is fully received/closed. Likely 0/1; confirm with SME.
Sequential line number within the parent PO.
Code for line category (e.g., part, labor, misc). Values are system-defined; confirm with SME.
Inventory item/part identifier being procured on this line.
Trade/craft associated with a labor-type line, if applicable; confirm with SME.
Additional charge on the line (e.g., freight, fees) not included in item cost.
Receiving or stocking warehouse/location code for the line’s items.
Associated resource(s) for the line (e.g., technician, vendor resource). Likely a reference; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating if the line was entered by a user rather than generated by workflow.
User or requester who initiated the need for this purchase.
Phone number for the requester of this purchase.
Email address for the requester of this purchase.
Optional external or internal reference (e.g., quote, vendor ref, requisition). Usage may vary; confirm with SME.
Date/time the line was created or committed for ordering.
Quantity requested for procurement on this line.
Monetary amount for the ordered quantity at the time of order (line amount, typically pre-tax).
Unit of measure used for the ordered quantity.
Quantity received into stock or issued to a job against this line; confirm intended direction with SME.
Monetary amount associated with the received/issued quantity (actual line amount).
Unit of measure used for the received/issued quantity.
Tax group/code applied to the line; determines tax components. Meaning of values should be confirmed with SME.
Amount of the first tax component applied to this line.
Amount of the second tax component applied to this line.
Amount of the third tax component applied to this line.
Vendor’s promised ship date for this line, if provided.
Estimated date the items/services will be available at the destination.
Work order to which costs and materials from this line are charged, if applicable.
Asset receiving the item/service or being maintained via this purchase.
Maintenance procedure/task associated with this line; likely a reference to a standard job. Confirm with SME.
GL account to be charged for this line’s costs.
Allocation details when costs are split across multiple GL accounts; confirm storage format with SME.
Project or job code to which this line’s costs are allocated.
Controls whether remaining estimated parts from an associated plan/WO should be consumed; likely boolean/flag. Confirm with SME.
Controls whether remaining estimated labor should be consumed from an associated plan/WO; likely boolean/flag. Confirm with SME.
Controls whether remaining estimated miscellaneous costs should be consumed; likely boolean/flag. Confirm with SME.
Free-text notes for this line.
System timestamp of the most recent update to this line.
Flag to enable/disable notifications (e.g., on receipt/closure) to interested users; confirm behavior with SME.
Additional processing flags/bitmask for this line; semantics are system-specific. Confirm with SME.
Timestamp of the last user-initiated modification (as opposed to background processes).
Ship-to or stocking location identifier for the items on this line.
Date/time when the line was closed/fully completed.
Multiplier converting the ordered unit of measure to the inventory/base unit.
Identifier of the user who created this line.
Date/time when this line was initially created by a user.
Identifier of the user who last modified this line.
Date/time of the last user-driven modification to this line.
